title: How to Seal a Plastic Gas Tank

steps.title: Drain the gasoline from the tank and allow it to dry.
steps.content: Drain the gasoline from the tank and allow it to dry. Sand the area around the hole or crack, and clean the area with a shop cloth saturated with rubbing alcohol. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mix the 2 part epoxy together and apply all around the perimeter of the opening.
steps.content: Mix the 2 part epoxy together and apply all around the perimeter of the opening. [2] X Research source Cut a fiberglass patch large enough to cover the opening and overlap it.

steps.title: Place the fiberglass patch over the hole and press into the epoxy.
steps.content: Place the fiberglass patch over the hole and press into the epoxy. Apply more epoxy to the patch and surrounding area, pressing firmly to saturate the patch.

steps.title: Allow to dry, sand the patched area smooth and spray paint with a plastic paint if desired.
steps.content: Allow to dry, sand the patched area smooth and spray paint with a plastic paint if desired.

steps.title: Buy or rent a plastic welder.
steps.content: Buy or rent a plastic welder. Tell the salesperson what you are doing with it to ensure that you get the correct rods.

steps.title: Remove the plastic gas tank from the vehicle, and set it up in a secure welding area.
steps.content: Remove the plastic gas tank from the vehicle, and set it up in a secure welding area. Drain the gasoline from the tank, and allow it to dry both inside and outside. Don protective eye gear, a welding helmet and welding gloves.

steps.title: Use a plastic welding rod made specially for this purpose, and fill in the crack or hole.
steps.content: Use a plastic welding rod made specially for this purpose, and fill in the crack or hole. Start at an edge and run the bead completely around the opening. Then begin crossing over the hole, allowing the rod to fill in the hole completely. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the weld to set up, sand it smooth and, if desired, paint it with plastic spray paint.
steps.content: Allow the weld to set up, sand it smooth and, if desired, paint it with plastic spray paint.

steps.title: Replace the repaired plastic fuel tank on the vehicle.
steps.content: Replace the repaired plastic fuel tank on the vehicle.

steps.title: Drain the gas tank, and clean it inside and out with soapy water.
steps.content: Drain the gas tank, and clean it inside and out with soapy water. [4] X Research source Lightly sand the perimeter of the area to be repaired.

steps.title: Cut a plastic patch, made of a similar material to the gas tank, slightly larger than the hole to be repaired.
steps.content: Cut a plastic patch, made of a similar material to the gas tank, slightly larger than the hole to be repaired.

steps.title: Heat up an electric soldering gun, and drag it around the edge of the crack to create a trench.
steps.content: Heat up an electric soldering gun, and drag it around the edge of the crack to create a trench. Move the gun from side to side to push the plastic back into the trench. While the plastic is still soft from the soldering, lay the plastic patch over the area. Continue moving the soldering gun over the area to smooth the plastic, and fuse them together. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Allow to cool and dry completely.
steps.content: Allow to cool and dry completely. Mix a 2 part epoxy glue, and cover the entire area of the patch. [6] X Research source Allow to set up, sand and spray on a coat of plastic paint if desired.
